content: While it's true that some Dada artists did embrace unconventional and experimental elements in their music, it's important to note that many of these artists were actually highly trained and accomplished musicians. For example, Erik Satie, who was associated with the Dada movement, was a formally trained pianist and composer. Additionally, many Dadaist sound poets, such as Hugo Ball and Kurt Schwitters, had backgrounds in writing and literature, and drew upon techniques from these fields to create their sound compositions. So while it's true that Dada music was not always concerned with technical proficiency or traditional musical structures, it did not necessarily arise from a lack of musical ability, but rather from a desire to push the boundaries of what was considered acceptable in the world of music and art.
